title: Chinese Developers Get State Help to Tap Bond Market
sub_head: Country Garden, Longfor and Midea Real Estate are making use of credit derivatives to help get new deals done
body:
China is helping some stronger developers tap the domestic bond market, the latest move to support the ailing property sector amid a broader economic slowdown.
With the industry in crisis, markets in mainland China and abroad are mostly shut to privately owned developers. The new deals address that problem by packaging some bonds with credit derivatives, so that buyers are shielded against the risk of default.
